003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.ArrayDeque;
014import java.util.Deque;
015
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.EigenDecompositionJama;
020import imagingbook.common.util.SortMap;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This class implements incremental orthogonal line fitting to a set of 2D
025 * points using eigendecomposition (see {@link OrthogonalLineFitEigen} for
026 * a non-incremental version). See Sec. 10.3 (Alg. 10.4) of [1] for additional
027 * details.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * This fitter behaves like a queue: sample points may be added and removed
031 * freely either at its front or its end, while the ordering of the remaining
032 * points remains unchanged. This is to simplify back-tracking, for example for
033 * incremental contour fitting. Whenever a point is added or removed, the
034 * internal statistics (scatter matrix) are updated. The current line fit can be
035 * queried any time as long as there are more than two points in the point set
036 * (otherwise an exception is thrown).
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
040 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
041 * </p>
042 * 
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2022/09/29 revised
045 * @see OrthogonalLineFitEigen
046 * @see Deque
047 */
048public class IncrementalLineFit implements LineFit {    // extends ArrayDeque<Pnt2d> 
049        
050        private final Deque<Pnt2d> points;
051        private double[] p;                                                                     // current line parameters A,B,C
052        private double Sx, Sy, Sxx, Syy, Sxy;   // current scatter statistics
053        
054        /**
055         * Constructor creating a fitter with an empty set of points.
056         */
057        public IncrementalLineFit() {
058                this(null);
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * Constructor accepting a sequence of initial points.
063         * The first point is placed at the from of the queue,
064         * the last point at its end.
065         * 
066         * @param initPnts an array of initial points
067         */
068        public IncrementalLineFit(Pnt2d[] initPnts) {   
069                points = new ArrayDeque<>();
070                p = null;
071                Sx = 0;
072                Sy = 0;
073                Sxx = 0;
074                Syy = 0;
075                Sxy = 0;
076                if (initPnts == null) {
077                        return;
078                }
079                for (Pnt2d p : initPnts) {
080                        this.add(p);
081                }
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Calculates and returns the sum of the squared orthogonal distances
086         * of the current point set for this line fit.
087         * 
088         * @return the squared orthogonal error
089         * @see LineFit#getSquaredOrthogonalError(Pnt2d[])
090         */
091        public double getSquaredOrthogonalError() {
092                return getSquaredOrthogonalError(this.getPoints());
093        }
094        
095        // update statistics at point addition/removal --------------------- 
096        
097        private void addSamplePoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
098                final double x = pnt.getX();
099                final double y = pnt.getY();
100                Sx += x;
101                Sy += y;
102                Sxx += sqr(x);
103                Syy += sqr(y);
104                Sxy += x * y;
105                this.p = null;  // invalidate previous line parameters
106        }
107        
108        private void removeSamplePoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
109                final double x = pnt.getX();
110                final double y = pnt.getY();
111                Sx -= x;
112                Sy -= y;
113                Sxx -= sqr(x);
114                Syy -= sqr(y);
115                Sxy -= x * y;
116                this.p = null;  // invalidate previous line parameters
117        }
118        
119        // --------------------------------------------------------
120        
121        public Pnt2d[] getPoints() {
122                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
123        }
124        
125        // delegate methods matching those of Deque interface
126        
127        public boolean add(Pnt2d pnt) {
128                addLast(pnt);
129                return true;
130        }
131        
132        public void addFirst(Pnt2d pnt) {
133                points.addFirst(pnt);
134                addSamplePoint(pnt);
135        }
136        
137        public void addLast(Pnt2d pnt) {
138                points.addLast(pnt);
139                addSamplePoint(pnt);
140        }
141        
142        public Pnt2d removeFirst() {
143                Pnt2d pnt = points.removeFirst();
144                removeSamplePoint(pnt);
145                return pnt;
146        }
147        
148        public Pnt2d removeLast() {
149                Pnt2d pnt = points.removeLast();
150                removeSamplePoint(pnt);
151                return pnt;
152        }
153        
154        public Pnt2d peekFirst() {
155                return points.peekFirst();
156        }
157        
158        public Pnt2d peekLast() {
159                return points.peekLast();
160        }
161        
162        // --------------------------------------------------------
163        
164        @Override
165        public int getSize() {
166                return points.size();
167        }
168        
169        @Override
170        public double[] getLineParameters() {
171                if (this.getSize() < 2) {
172                        throw new IllegalStateException("cannot fit line, set of point set is less than 2");
173                }
174                if (p == null) {
175                        this.p = fit(points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]));
176                }
177                return p;
178        }
179        
180        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts) {
181                final int n = pts.length;
182                
183                double sxx = Sxx - sqr(Sx) / n;
184                double syy = Syy - sqr(Sy) / n;
185                double sxy = Sxy - Sx * Sy / n;
186                
187                double[][] S = {
188                                {sxx, sxy},
189                                {sxy, syy}};
190                
191                EigenDecompositionJama es = new EigenDecompositionJama(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(S));
192                int k = SortMap.getNthSmallestIndex(es.getRealEigenvalues(), 0);
193                double[] e = es.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
194                
195                double A = e[0];
196                double B = e[1];
197                double C = -(A * Sx + B * Sy) / n;
198                
199                return new double[] {A, B, C};
200        }
201                
202}
